attributes.action: Stop the proposed Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill
attributes.additional_details:
This is a frightening attack on the freedom of the public to hold the government responsible and fight for the equality that they impede.

Amend the Bill to remove the vague content regarding protest which infringes human rights. It removes our right to freely defend our liberty and hold an disturbingly draconian and authoritarian government to account.
attributes.background: Stop the proposed Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill Which has serious implications on the right to protest peacefully.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not restrict our rights to peaceful protest: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579012

Remove single person protest clauses in Police, Crime, Sentencing & Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578875

Do not pass the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579242
